# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/ad/aco/get/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def get(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send GET request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    query_string = urlencode({k: v if isinstance(v, string_types) else json.dumps(v) for k, v in args.items()})
    url = build_url(PATH, query_string)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
    }
    rsp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    adgroup_ids_list = ADGROUP_IDS
    adgroup_ids = json.dumps(adgroup_ids_list)

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"adgroup_ids\": %s}" % (advertiser_id, adgroup_ids)
    print(get(my_args))

# type: (str, str) -> str
"""

    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

# type: (str) -> dict

    args = json.loads(json_str)
    query_string = urlencode({k: v if isinstance(v, string_types) else json.dumps(v) for k, v in args.items()})

    }
    rsp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/ad/update/status/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    opt_status = OPT_STATUS
    ad_ids_list = AD_IDS
    ad_ids = json.dumps(ad_ids_list)

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"opt_status\": \"%s\", \"ad_ids\": %s}" % (advertiser_id, opt_status, ad_ids)
    print(post(my_args))

# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/adgroup/appeal/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    adgroup_id = ADGROUP_ID
    ad_id = AD_ID
    appeal_reason = APPEAL_REASON
    attachment_list_list = ATTACHMENT_LIST
    attachment_list = json.dumps(attachment_list_list)

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"adgroup_id\": \"%s\", \"ad_id\": \"%s\", \"appeal_reason\": \"%s\", \"attachment_list\": %s}" % (advertiser_id, adgroup_id, ad_id, appeal_reason, attachment_list)
    print(post(my_args))

import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/adgroup/get/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def get(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send GET request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    query_string = urlencode({k: v if isinstance(v, string_types) else json.dumps(v) for k, v in args.items()})
    url = build_url(PATH, query_string)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
    }
    rsp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    return rsp.json()

# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/bc/image/upload/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(bc_id, image_filepath, file_name=''):
    payload = {'bc_id': str(bc_id)}
    files = [
        ('image_file', (file_name,
                        open(image_filepath, 'rb')))
    ]
    headers = {
        'Access-Token': ACCESS_TOKEN
    }

    response = requests.request("POST", build_url(PATH), headers=headers, data=payload, files=files)
    return response.text

if __name__ == '__main__':
    bc_id = BC_ID
    image_file = IMAGE_FILE

    print(post(bc_id, image_file))

page_title: Create an asynchronous campaign copy task

example_code.code:
# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/campaign/create/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    budget_mode = BUDGET_MODE
    objective_type = OBJECTIVE_TYPE
    budget = BUDGET
    campaign_name = CAMPAIGN_NAME

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"budget_mode\": \"%s\", \"objective_type\": \"%s\", \"budget\": \"%s\", \"campaign_name\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id, budget_mode, objective_type, budget, campaign_name)
    print(post(my_args))

# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/campaign/get/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def get(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send GET request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    query_string = urlencode({k: v if isinstance(v, string_types) else json.dumps(v) for k, v in args.items()})
    url = build_url(PATH, query_string)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
    }
    rsp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    fields_list = FIELDS
    fields = json.dumps(fields_list)
    status = STATUS
    campaign_name = CAMPAIGN_NAME
    objective_type = OBJECTIVE_TYPE
    campaign_ids_list = CAMPAIGN_IDS
    campaign_ids = json.dumps(campaign_ids_list)
    primary_status = PRIMARY_STATUS
    page = PAGE
    page_size = PAGE_SIZE

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"fields\": %s, \"filtering\": {\"status\": \"%s\", \"campaign_name\": \"%s\", \"objective_type\": \"%s\", \"campaign_ids\": %s, \"primary_status\": \"%s\"}, \"page\": \"%s\", \"page_size\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id, fields, status, campaign_name, objective_type, campaign_ids, primary_status, page, page_size)
    print(get(my_args))

page_title: Update the operation statuses of campaigns

example_code.code:
# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/campaign/update/status/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    campaign_ids_list = CAMPAIGN_IDS
    campaign_ids = json.dumps(campaign_ids_list)
    opt_status = OPT_STATUS

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"campaign_ids\": %s, \"opt_status\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id, campaign_ids, opt_status)
    print(post(my_args))

import http.client
import json

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("business-api.tiktok.com")
payload = json.dumps({
  "bc_id": 123456,
  "catalog_id": 123456
})
headers = {
  'Access-Token': 'xxxx',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
conn.request("GET", "/open_api/v1.3/catalog/product/get/", payload, headers)
res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()
print(data.decode("utf-8"))

# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/comment/delete/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    ad_id = AD_ID
    tiktok_item_id = TIKTOK_ITEM_ID
    comment_id = COMMENT_ID
    identity_type = IDENTITY_TYPE
    identity_id = IDENTITY_ID

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"ad_id\": \"%s\", \"tiktok_item_id\": \"%s\", \"comment_id\": \"%s\", \"identity_type\": \"%s\", \"identity_id\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id, ad_id, tiktok_item_id, comment_id, identity_type, identity_id)
    print(post(my_args))

import json

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/comment/list/"
def build_url(path, query=""):

    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring

    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def get(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send GET request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format

import json

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/creative/smart_video/create/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)

import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/dmp/custom_audience/delete/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    custom_audience_ids_list = CUSTOM_AUDIENCE_IDS
    custom_audience_ids = json.dumps(custom_audience_ids_list)

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"custom_audience_ids\": %s}" % (advertiser_id, custom_audience_ids)
    print(post(my_args))

example_code.code:
# coding=utf-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/identity/create/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))

def post(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
    }
    rsp = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=args)
    return rsp.json()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    image_uri = IMAGE_URI
    display_name = DISPLAY_NAME

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\", \"image_uri\": \"%s\", \"display_name\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id, image_uri, display_name)
    print(post(my_args))

import json
from typing import Optional

import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse  # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/playable/upload/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: (str, str) -> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))


def post(json_str, files=None):
# type: (str,Optional[dict]) -> dict
"""
    Send POST request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :param files: file dict
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    url = build_url(PATH)
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
    }
    if file_args:
        rsp = requests.post(url, files=files, headers=headers, data=args)
    else:
        headers["Content-Type"] = "application/json"
        rsp = requests.post(url, files=files, headers=headers, json=args)

    return rsp.json()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    advertiser_id = ADVERTISER_ID
    playable_package = open(PLYABLE_FILE_PATH, "rb")

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{\"advertiser_id\": \"%s\"}" % (advertiser_id)
    file_args = {"playable_package": playable_package}
    print(post(my_args, files=file_args))

import requests

# type: (str, str) -> str

"""

    headers = {

headers.Country-Code: A country or region code that is associated with the TikTok One Creator Marketplace campaign (campaign_id).To obtain a valid country or region code associated with the TikTok One Creator Marketplace campaign, use/tto/tcm/campaign/and select one code from the returnedcountry_codes.

response_fields: Response parameters of the same nameNote: These parameters might be nested within different objects or object arrays
Response parameter name and data type

example_code.code:
# coding=utf\-8
import json
import requests

from six import string_types
from six.moves.urllib.parse import urlencode, urlunparse # noqa

ACCESS_TOKEN = "xxx"
PATH = "/open_api/v1.3/user/info/"
def build_url(path, query=""):
# type: \(str\, str\) \-\> str
"""
    Build request URL
    :param path: Request path
    :param query: Querystring
    :return: Request URL
    """
    scheme, netloc = "https", "business-api.tiktok.com"
return urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, "", query, ""))
    
def get(json_str):
# type: (str) -> dict
"""
    Send GET request
    :param json_str: Args in JSON format
    :return: Response in JSON format
    """
    args = json.loads(json_str)
    query_string = urlencode({k: v if isinstance(v, string_types) else json.dumps(v) for k, v in args.items()})
    url = build_url(PATH, query_string)
    headers = {
        "Access-Token": ACCESS_TOKEN,
    }
    rsp = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
    return rsp.json()
    
if __name__ == '__main__':

    # Args in JSON format
    my_args = "{}"
    print(get(my_args))
